instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on CPU Vcore
threads.message: I have a solid short on CPU Vcore (1Î© to ground) after a spill on the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area only. <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> was shorted also until I removed <RESISTOR>R7310</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7320</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7330</RESISTOR> to isolate the short. Any hope or is this pretty much a dead CPU?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on CPU Vcore
threads.message: The end. I don't even take these apart anymore when PPBUS is shorted the Vcore. Scrapped one tonight without even spending 5 minutes on it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on CPU Vcore
threads.message: Yeah, I've just reached that point also now. Thanks.
